definitions.definition: The result or outcome of a cause.
definitions.example: The effect of the hurricane was a devastated landscape.

definitions.definition: Impression left on the mind; sensation produced.
An illusion produced by technical means (as in "special effect")
definitions.example: The effect of flying was most convincing.

definitions.definition: (sound engineering) An alteration, or device for producing an alteration, in sound after it has been produced by an instrument.
definitions.example: I just bought a couple of great effects.

definitions.definition: (etc.) A scientific phenomenon, usually named after its discoverer.
(usually in the plural) Belongings, usually as personal effects.
Consequence intended; purpose; meaning; general intent; with to.
Reality; actual meaning; fact, as distinguished from mere appearance.
To make or bring about; to implement.
definitions.example: The best way to effect change is to work with existing stakeholders.
